msContents.summary: The is an agreement between a man (Paneith), woman (Tikas) and another person his name seems to be missing, concerning buying a house; and it mentions the conditions of the agreement.

condition.ab: This document consists of 3 fragments, when placed in their relative position, they give an over all width of about 26 cm. It has the upper and right margins. The papyrus is badly damaged and some parts are missing. The ink is almost washed out in some parts such as in the left hand side of the first fragment.

origin.persName: Paneith the younger, son of Orses, his mother (being) Tanas

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: (1)Year 20, Hathyr, day (12) [of Pharaoh] Ptolemy, son of [Ptolemy] and Ar[si]noe the gods who love [their] father, (2) [the priest of] Alexander [and the] brother gods [and the beneficent gods [and the gods who love] their [father] and the [gods] who appear (being) Timotheos, (3) [ (son of) T]imotheos, Praxini[ko], daughter of Philinos, (being) the bearer of [the gift of victory] before Berenice the beneficent [goddess], (4) Hedule, daughter of Ptolemy, (being) the bearer of the golden basket before Ar[sinoe the] brother [loving], Eirene, daughter of [Ptolemy], (5) (being) the priestess of Arsinoe who loves her [father].;The agreement to which [. . . . . Pa]neith the younger, son of [Orses], [his mother (being) [Ta]nas came, being two persons, one [man] and one woman, in the presence of [the arbt] Pneferos, son of Petesouchos, (in) year 20, [[Hathyr].; [they spoke] (7) in the presence of the arbt Pnefer[os] aforesaid, saying:;we have given to thee the letter of agreement [whose conditions] [are written] [below] (concerning) the house which we bought (8) [from . . . . .] . . Patous] [ . . . . . ] �Ǫ half [om its] western [side], and (9) [Tikas, daughter of Teos,] owns [. . . . . . . . .];Verso;On the left edge of the verso are the traces of a few signs belonging to the title of the document. Of the witness names, parts of six only are now extant.

listBibl.bibl: Nims CF, Diss, 47, 1937, Pl VIII Nims CF, JEA 24, 78-9, 1938
